definition: to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: Sleeping naked on benches by the lake under the sun of summer, is quite a leisure that I can certainly enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的時候坦腹睡在岸邊的長凳上，也是自得其樂。

sentences.english: The vast sea allows fishes to leap about, and open sky leaves birds to glide.
sentences.chinese: 海空任魚躍，天高任鳥飛，悠悠然自得其樂。

sentences.english: Also, nerds get a high out of building stuff.
sentences.chinese: 書呆子們在建設某種東西的過程中自得其樂。

sentences.english: This is me, a lonely but somebody's butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我，一隻落寞但是卻自得其樂的蝴蝶。

sentences.english: And their philosophy is " I know I how to earn money when I know how to spend money".
sentences.chinese: 他們的格言是“能花才更能賺”，花光用光自得其樂。

sentences.english: Since then, whenever I have had the opportunity, I have gone to the top of the tower and enjoyed myself.
sentences.chinese: 從此一有機會，我就上到塔樓頂上去自得其樂。

sentences.english: I am really enjoying myself at the moment.
The wide sea allows the fish to leap about and vast sky the birds to fly.
sentences.chinese: 海空任魚躍，天高任鳥飛，悠悠然自得其樂。

sentences.english: Female lawyers have a tendency to intimidate men, and enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 女律師們常常會嚇跑男士，並且自得其樂。

sentences.english: He liked to go to dances and parties, where he could have a good time just sitting and watching.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡參加舞會和晚會，自得其樂地坐着看。

sentences.english: You’ll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 你全身都會髒掉，而它卻自得其樂。

sentences.english: Now, I'm standing in the kitchen carvin' up the chicken for dinner, minding my own business.
sentences.chinese: 當時我在廚房裏切雞肉，準備晚飯，自得其樂。

sentences.english: But this is a life I enjoy very much, all by myself, for myself.
sentences.chinese: 但是我很享受這樣的生活，自力更生，自得其樂。

definition: to stand aloof from worldly affairs
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
